candidates.name: Jay Webb
candidates.why_elect: I have a varied and extensive set of skills that I've obtained over a very long career in project,operations and recruitment management throughout the construction,demolition and civil industries. This means I have the experience and knowledge in many core council functions and can quickly identify problems and cost saving measures.
candidates.why_stand: I've experienced the total disregard for local residents and businesses by current councillors who seem to go about their own agendas without council or community notification. It's simply not good enough. The residents of the Waimakariri district deserve an honest and cost effective council with important environmental and social issues ahead.

candidates.name: Paul Williams
candidates.why_elect: I am a successful businessperson and I am willing to listen and be accountable for my actions. I will stand up for what is right and what is good for our ratepayers. I am not afraid of a good challenge.
candidates.why_stand: I want Waimakariri to be an affordable place to live for our future generations. We cannot continue with the amount of rate increases above inflation. I know that I have the financial ability to address some of the council's financial debts.

candidates.name: Kirstyn Barnett
candidates.why_elect: I have over 10 years local government experience, including as a District Councillor since 2010. I am a trained RMA commissioner, facilitator, project manager, and run my own marketing business. Having lived in both urban and rural locations, and raising a family here, I bring a real-life perspective to council.
candidates.why_stand: I love living in Waimakariri and want to see the consistent, community-led decision-making since the 2010 earthquake continue, to ensure a strong future for our district. We are facing significant challenges with water and rising compliance costs, and need a Mayor who is adaptable, confident and a team player.

candidates.name: Michael Joseph Bate
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community my whole life and am a keen outdoors person, fisherman and hunter. I am saddened and disappointed with the authorities attitude towards our environment and our basic wellbeing. I have the benefit of being tied to no political party.
candidates.why_stand: I can see that our district has severe environmental issues that have been ignored or pushed into the background in past years. I would like our district to be environmentally clean to the benefit of our residents and wildlife.

candidates.name: Robbie Brine
candidates.why_elect: My 38 year professional career has involved crisis management, problem solving and dispute resolution. I am a very good negotiator and believe I supply a strong voice for our district.
candidates.why_stand: At 21 years as Councillor I believe I have the experience and skills to lead our council, by extension our staff and community through the challenges faced not only in our district but across the region. Water quality, natural hazards, Climate change to name a few.

candidates.name: Dan Gordon
candidates.why_elect: I love our District. I know it well. I have extensive experience, energy, an approachable nature and involvement in many community organisations. Combined with my long-term council experience makes me the best choice for mayor.
candidates.why_stand: Waimakariri's population is projected to grow from 60,000 to 75,000. Preparing for this increase requires experienced leadership. We need energetic and enthusiastic leadership; someone who knows our district and our needs. I have 15 years council experience. I'm approachable, friendly and have a strong track record of creating positive change.

candidates.name: Natalie Michelle Leary
candidates.why_elect: My first job was with the district council in the forestry at Woodend beach. Since then I have worked with local primary schools and many sports clubs. I am currently involved in the Civil defence as a volunteer, and a trustee of the Kaiapoi food forest.
candidates.why_stand: I believe our district is beautiful and unique. I feel we also have room to improve.

candidates.name: Oliver Sanderson
candidates.why_elect: I'm 34 years old, grew up in Waikuku and attended Rangiora High School. I served in the New Zealand Army as both a soldier and a commissioned officer. I offer a fresh new leadership approach based on the core values of courage, loyalty, integrity and pursuit of excellence, not politics.
candidates.why_stand: Because I have full confidence in my ability to provide this district with the highest standards of leadership and governance. I desire to make a real positive difference in our community.
